page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT
page.content:
Apart from farming the majority of work is either in the village or on the Duke of Wellington's estate. This, however is not enough to employ the population of the village (438), therefore most of the people commute to Reading for work. { {Farming There are nine farms, but they are small and do not need many workers. The largest, 'Home Farm', employs fifteen workers. { {Work On The Estate The Duke of Wellington hires a number of helpers, but these helpers need to be specialized and usually come from elsewhere.
There is very little employment in the{village.
